      • computeBackwardDifferentialFromRoundKeys

        public Differential computeBackwardDifferentialFromRoundKeys(int fromRound,
                                                    int toRound,
                                                    ByteArray startingStateDifference,
                                                    ByteArray startingKeyDifference,
                                                    ByteArray firstExpandedKey)

      • computeBackwardDifferentialFromRoundKeys

        public Differential computeBackwardDifferentialFromRoundKeys(int fromRound,
                                                    int toRound,
                                                    ByteArray firstStartingState,
                                                    ByteArray secondStartingState,
                                                    ByteArray firstExpandedKey,
                                                    ByteArray secondExpandedKey)
        Generates a forward differential trail for the given cipher from fromRound to toRound, including toRound. E. g. if fromRound = 8 and toRound = 10, the differential will start at round 8 and move forwards to round 10. Used by the BicliqueFinder to compute biclique differentials: s <- c (different c, different round keys) s <- c (different c, different round keys), since \Delta c = 0 in DifferenceBuilder Backward differential (fromround <- toround) : startKeyDifference, startStateDifference
        Parameters:
        fromRound - The first round of the differential that is included in the differential.
        firstStartingState - The starting state at round toRound for the first computation.
        secondStartingState - The starting state at round toRound for the second computation.
        firstExpandedKey - The expanded key which is used for the first computation.
        secondExpandedKey - The expanded key which is used for the second computation.
        Returns:
        The forward differential.

      • computeForwardDifferentialFromRoundKeys

        public Differential computeForwardDifferentialFromRoundKeys(int fromRound,
                                                   int toRound,
                                                   ByteArray startingStateDifference,
                                                   ByteArray startingKeyDifference,
                                                   ByteArray firstExpandedKey)

      • computeForwardDifferentialFromRoundKeys

        public Differential computeForwardDifferentialFromRoundKeys(int fromRound,
                                                   int toRound,
                                                   ByteArray firstStartingState,
                                                   ByteArray secondStartingState,
                                                   ByteArray firstExpandedKey,
                                                   ByteArray secondExpandedKey)
        Generates a backward differential trail for the given cipher from toRound to fromRound, including fromRound. E. g. if fromRound = 8 and toRound = 10, the differential will start at round 10 and move backwards to round 8. Used by the BicliqueFinder to compute biclique differentials: s -> c (different s, different round keys) s -> c (same s, different round keys), da \Delta s = 0 in DifferenceBuilder Forward differential (fromround -> toround) : startKeyDifference, startStateDifference
        Parameters:
        fromRound - The first round of the differential that is included in the differential.
        toRound - The last round of the differential that is included in the differential.
        firstStartingState - The starting state at round fromRound for the first computation.
        secondStartingState - The starting state at round fromRound for the second computation.
        firstExpandedKey - The expanded key which is used for the first computation.
        secondExpandedKey - The expanded key which is used for the second computation.
        Returns:
        The backward differential.
